intro: Dicella ovatifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf dicella, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
